title: Forward Deployed Engineer
text:
C3.ai is a leading enterprise AI software provider for accelerating digital transformation. The comprehensive and proven C3 AI Suite uses a model-driven abstraction layer to enable organizations to develop, deploy, and operate enterprise scale AI applications 40x to 100x faster than alternative approaches. www.c3.ai

## Ai Platform To Solve Their Most Challenging, Never-before-solved Business Problems, Such As

Our customers - many of the largest, most complex organizations in the world - build applications on the C3.

  * _Aircraft Predictive Maintenance_ : predict aircraft system failures before they occur; empower flight engineers to more effectively manage fleet-wide flight plans and proactively schedule inspections and maintenance.
  * _Electricity Theft Detection_ : detect anomalous electricity consumption patterns, across millions of smart meters, indicative of energy theft; empower operators to more effectively prevent theft, prioritize field investigations, and recover lost revenue.
  * _Supply Chain Inventory Optimization_ : recommend safety stock levels to optimize inventory for thousands of SKUs across hundreds of distribution centers; empower plant managers to more effectively minimize costs while meeting service level targets.

As a Forward Deployed Engineer, you will be working with customers to design, develop, and deploy AI-based enterprise applications on the C3.ai Platform. An ideal candidate possesses strategic and analytical aptitude, software development expertise and excellent interpersonal skills.

## Responsibilities

  * Engage directly with customers to design, develop, and deploy AI-based enterprise applications
  * Write application specifications and documentation
  * Lead design and development reviews of customer applications
  * Test, troubleshoot, and enhance customer applications with and on behalf of customers
  * Continuously identify technical risks and gaps; devise mitigation strategies in anticipation of customer needs

## Required Qualifications

  * Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) field; graduate degree in STEM or business field preferred
  * Professional software development experience with JavaScript, Java, or other object-oriented programming languages
  * Analytical and problem-solving abilities
  * Organizational skills and attention to detail
  * Interpersonal communication skills and ability to work effectively on a cross-functional team
  * Ability to travel as needed

## Preferred Qualifications

  * Understanding of cloud computing concepts
  * Understanding of databases types and trade-offs
  * Proficiency in data structure and algorithm design and implementation
  * Proficiency in time-series data analysis, cleansing, and normalization
  * Working knowledge of Agile software development methodology
  * Experience building and deploying AI-based enterprise applications
  * Solid understanding of common machine learning techniques, applications, and trade-offs
  * Domain expertise in one or more of the following industries: Aerospace, Financial Services, Healthcare, Industrial Manufacturing, Oil & Gas, Public Sector, Power & Utilities, Supply Chain, Telecommunications

C3.ai provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits including:

  * Competitive salary, generous stock options, 401K, medical, dental, and vision benefits. At the Redwood City office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered breakfast and lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people.

C3.ai is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

title: Salesforce Administrator (Remote)
text:
At CrowdStrike we're on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We've earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people - clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you're ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let's talk.

## About The Role

CrowdStrike is looking for a Salesforce System Administrator to join our fast growing Customer Applications team. In this role, you will be responsible for the administration of Salesforce and related applications. Based on a deep understanding of Salesforce technology, you will work closely with our team of Business Systems Analysts and business users to develop best practice solutions and processes.

## What You'll Do

  * Responsible for daily operations of Salesforce
  * Participate in our agile development process to design, test, and implement new features
  * Maintain security and sharing model, role hierarchy, profiles, and assist with user management
  * Provide day to day administrative support for Salesforce
  * Document all changes to applications per internal controls
  * Create and maintain reports and dashboards
  * Assist with data quality and data management activities

## What You'll Need

  * Bachelor's degree (technical degree preferred)
  * 5+ years of experience implementing, configuring and administering SaaS business systems for a software company, with at least 3 years of Salesforce experience.
  * Detail-oriented, organized, self-motivated, hardworking, and a great team player with excellent interpersonal skills
  * Excellent written and verbal communication skills required, including experience meeting with and presenting information to senior leadership
  * Salesforce.com certification (Administrator, Advanced Administrator) preferred but not necessary
  * Passion for creating a frictionless end user experience
  * Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving scenario
  * Strong knowledge and understanding of the Salesforce.com platform, eco-system and best-practices

## Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike

  * Market leader in compensation and equity awards
  * Competitive vacation policy
  * Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
  * Paid parental leave, including adoption
  * Flexible work environment
  * Wellness programs
  * Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Data Analyst II - eComm, Measurement Insight
text:
## What You'll Do At

As a Data Analyst II - eComm, Measurement Insight you will be part of a strategic and fast growing team for Walmart Media Group. You will be responsible for supporting strategic analysis of omni-channel campaigns of some of the largest advertiser in the world. Leveraging your capacity to use tools like Tableau and SQL, you will derive both tactical and strategic insights and communicate them. Position Description Assist in managing the interpretation, analytics reporting, and analysis for key insights & performance recommendations with Walmart advertisers From strategy, planning, and campaign completion, the Analyst will deliver clarity to advertisers who are seeking causal insights and measurement impact Perform hands-on analysis and conduct in-depth investigations with the team, execute end-to-end measurement projects, and make actionable recommendations to the business Assist in process improvement initiatives to scale data and measurement solutions Contribute with building measurement/analytics tools and platforms reflect the best and most appropriate solutions available Data-Driven Best Practices, Recommendations, & Guidance, and Drive Future Actions with the clients are just a few of the many impactful deliverables Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor of Science and 2 years' data science experience OR 5 years' data science experience OR Master of Science Preferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. Relational Database Management System (RDMS), Statistical Programming Language Bachelors: Analytics, Bachelors: Economics, Bachelors: Mathematics, Bachelors: Statistics, Masters: Analytics, Masters: Economics, Masters: Mathematics, Masters: Statistics

## Minimum Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor of Science and 2 years' data science experience OR 5 years' data science experience OR Master of Science

## About Walmart

At Walmart, we help people save money so they can live better. This mission serves as the foundation for every decision we make, from responsible sourcing to sustainability-and everything in between. As a Walmart associate, you will play an integral role in shaping the future of retail, tech, merchandising, finance and hundreds of other industries-all while affecting the lives of millions of customers all over the world. Here, your work makes an impact every day. What are you waiting for?

"At Walmart, we get the opportunity to grow professionally and personally-all while improving how we work and what we deliver to consumers." - Lola, Project Analyst

**All the benefits you need for you and your family**

  * Multiple health plan options
  * Vision & dental plans for you & dependents
  * Associate discounts in-store and online
  * Financial benefits including 401(k), stock purchase plans and more
  * Education assistance for Associate and dependents

**Frequently asked questions**

  * **On average, how long does it take to fill out an application?**

On average, it takes 45-60 minutes to complete your application for the first time. Subsequent applications will take less time to apply as our system saves some of your application information. Please note that some positions require the completion of assessments in order to receive consideration for that role. Those would take additional time.

  * **Can I change my application after submitting?**

No, you cannot change your application after submitting, so please make sure that everything is finalized before you hit the submit button.

  * **How do you protect my personal information?**

Processing of information on paper is minimal, and Walmart processes application information using an applicant tracking system (ATS). Access to the data within the ATS is restricted to authorized personnel, and the system itself is held to high security standards by Walmart.

  * **What are the recommended Internet Browsers for applying for open roles?**
    * Internet Explorer 8.0+
    * Firefox 4.0+
    * Safari 4.0+
    * Chrome 12+

title: Systems Engineer, Connectivity Location
text:
## Description

_Position at Samsung Semiconductor, Inc._

**Job Title: Systems Engineer, Connectivity Location

Job ID: DSA33181

## Overview & Impact

Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. in San Jose is looking for a talented and motivated location systems engineer. Candidate will work as part of the Connectivity Location team responsible for system/algorithm design, modeling/implementation and product performance optimization of cutting-edge location IP that powers some of the top brands in mobile and wearable markets.

## Job Responsibilities

  * Develop key location technologies using GNSS signals such as GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, Beidou etc.
  * Design signal processing algorithms for the location stack including measurement, positioning and fusion layers.
  * Develop MATLAB, Python and/or C/C++ models to characterize algorithm performance.
  * Develop prototypes and proof-of-concept models to generate new candidate enhancement ideas and demonstrate their efficacy.
  * Collaborate closely with SW/FW engineers in implementation and validation of algorithms, and optimization for achieving target performance metrics.
  * Design test campaigns, characterize and optimize chip performance through lab and field tests.
  * Perform detailed data analysis of product logs for performance characterization and issue resolution efforts.
  * Must be open for occasional international travel (up to ~2 trips a year).

## REQUIRED SKILLS (Education Certificates, Licenses, Travel)

  * Deep understanding in two or more topics in GNSS receiver systems/algorithms such as KF, sensor fusion, VDR, PDR etc
  * Expertise in control theory, signal processing, estimation theory, and/or machine learning.
  * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  * Data analysis, visualization and triage experience.
  * Excellent communication and teamwork skills
  * C/C++, MATLAB programming experience
  * PhD with 2+ years or MS with 7+ years in Electrical Engineering, Aeronautical/Aerospace Engineering, Physics or related

## Prefered Skills

  * Background in GNSS acquisition/tracking, multipath mitigation, particle filtering etc
  * Experience with hybrid location technologies, indoor positioning, BLE, UWB etc
  * Experience is high accuracy GNSS and location fusion technologies for automotive products.
  * Hands-on experience with commercialization, driving test campaigns, engaging with external partners.

Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.- the second largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays.

A day in the life Samsung Video: http://bit.ly/1saHOGu

Click here to visit our Samsung Semiconductor Career Page**

title: Software DevOps Engineer - Payments
text:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you're looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon's media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and HuffPost help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we're transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.

Payments Platform serves Verizon Media and partners with efficient and secure payments ranging from credit cards to PayPal and Apple Pay. The platform processes transactions worth over hundreds of Millions, and is built using modern technologies and is hosted on both public cloud, own data centers. We work with leading payment processors and card networks like Visa, Mastercard and American Express to offer the best user experience and provide low operating costs for brands and products. Team also manages or supports all operations including handling of payment fraud and chargebacks.

## Position Responsibilities

  * Design and implement software affecting non-functional requirements especially related to maintainability, operability, scalability, measurement, monitoring, performance, resilience, and time to market.
  * Security Hardening
  * Build automation framework to maintain production operations overhead to low and simple.
  * Work with engineering and architecture to assess critical challenges and identify opportunities to define automated solutions for developer productivity and go-to-market.
  * Use monitoring systems to protect platform services through proactive monitoring and alerting.
  * Build infrastructure and drive projects that break things with the aim to improve the robustness of production systems.
  * Preventing abuse by implementing in-house throttling platforms like SafeT etc
  * Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning (BCP certification)
  * Modernizing and influence designs for key platforms e.g Payments, Identity,
  * Designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines (includes automated minor operating system upgrades, patch management etc)
  * Capacity Planning and Management.
  * Strong influence over immediate team members, drive wider architectural discussions to uplift product quality & operability.
  * Mentors and provides specialized technical guidance to junior engineers.

**Position Opportunity**

This position will have an opportunity to collaborate/engage with key stakeholders, customers in defining forward-looking strategy for Verizon Media Payments Platforms. Collaborate with Senior Architects, technical lead engineers to grow as technical leader across a wide variety of technology footprint and drive complex projects that involves coordination across several business units, external vendors / partners.

## Position Requirements

Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Certified Cloud services
(AWS or Azure) professional with minimum 5 years of experience involving each of the following:

  * Experience in programming languages (Python, Go, Java, etc.)
  * Experience in designing, debugging and running fault tolerant large-scale distributed systems
  * Public Cloud and services expertise, including Amazon Web Services such as AMI, Route 53, ECS, RDS, Dynamo, LAMBDA, SQS, Cloudwatch, CodeBuild and S3 etc..
  * Networking technologies such as HTTPs, TLS1.2, TCP/IP and DNS.
  * Expertise in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines (includes automated minor operating system upgrades, patch management etc)
  * Modern software engineering processes, including CI/CD and automated testing.
  * Experience in setting up monitoring systems (e.g. Splunk).
  * Experience in SOX, PCI compliance.

Verizon Media is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category. Verizon Media is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment. If you need accessibility assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, please submit a request via the Accommodation Request Form ( https://www.verizonmedia.com/careers/contact-us.html ) or call 408-336-1409. Requests and calls received for non-disability related issues, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

_Currently work for Verizon Media? Please apply on our internal career site._

title: Analyst, Finance Analytics
text:
**THE ROLE**

Tesla's mission is to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy. Tesla's Finance Analytics team sits at the intersection of financial analysis, business intelligence, data engineering, and data science to support this mission by converting raw data into actionable insights.

We are looking for a talented analyst who is passionate about analytics, automation, and business decision making. This analyst will be an "analytics generalist" who will work side-by-side "analytics specialists" such as financial analytsts, data engineers, and data scientists. Successful analysts on our team have come from both business and technical backgrounds but all share a growth mindset and are constantly growing their knowledge and skills through continuous learning.

## Responsibilities

  * Perform rigorous analyses on large, complex data sets and provide strategic insights, hypotheses, and conclusions based upon findings to leaders at all levels
  * Work with business and engineering teams to drive the development of Tesla's data, reporting, and analytics platforms
  * Build, maintain, and improve data models, forecast models, dashboards, and data pipelines
  * Create clean, reliable, and scalable "single-source-of-truth" data sets by partnering with data quality and application engineering teams to address data issues in upstream systems and document data lineage, business logic, and KPI definitions
  * Partner with business analysts to help automate manual workflows and train them in tools and skills to become self-sufficient as needed

## Requirements

  * 2+ years of relavant experience
  * BS/MS in STEM or quantitative field (CS, Applied Statistics, Operations Research) or BS/MBA in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Analytics
  * Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with commercial and emerging BI databases, technologies, and languages
  * Experience with data analytics tools and languages (Python, R)
  * Experience with advanced Excel BI functionality and languages (Power Query (M), PowerPivot (DAX))
  * Knowledge of accounting principles, financial statements, and financial modeling
  * Experience working with enterprise systems and understanding of data design pattern differences between transactional ERP systems and analytical data warehouses
  * Ability to self-start and self-direct work in an unstructured environment, comfortable dealing with ambiguity
  * Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills and ability to change direction quickly

## Preferred

  * Experience with Python-based data visualization packages and tools (Matplotlib, Plotly, Superset)
  * Experience in building, deploying and maintaining data pipelines using open source tools like Python and Airflow
  * Experience designing and building machine learning models with open source machine learning libraries and frameworks (Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, Keras)
  * Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  * Experience with git and version control workflows
  * Experience continuous integration pipelines and infrastructure (Docker, Jenkins, Kubernetes)
  * Experience with application development frameworks (Flask, Django, JQuery, Angular)
  * Knowledge of various data communication protocols (REST API, Websockets)

title: Build Systems Engineer (Remote)
text:
At CrowdStrike we're on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We've earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people - clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you're ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let's talk.

## About The Role

Like to ship meaningful products and generally get.. stuff.. done? As a Build Engineer on CrowdStrike's Build Systems team, you will be a key member of the team that keeps our software factory humming. Want to shape the technical vision around our continuous integration pipeline? Build tools and automation that take us through the next 10x of growth? Make developers smile by improving inner loop efficiency? If so, this job is for you!

## Responsibilities

  * Expertise with various consumer and enterprise operating systems (Windows, Linux, MacOS, iOS, Android) operating at scale.
  * Expertise with virtualization administration, preferably VMWare 6+ in a clustered environment.
  * Monitoring, maintenance, and operation of a production environment
  * Troubleshoot server hardware issues
  * Automate common tasks, deploy with an IaaS model, extensive experience with enterprise-grade configuration management tools (Chef, Puppet, Salt, Ansible)
  * Familiarity with Software Development Lifecycle elements such as build/test/deploy.
  * Experience administering or maintaining CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Bamboo, Azure DevOps, Gitlab, for large-scale operations.
  * Experience managing source-code repositories utilizing git (Bitbucket, Gitlab, etc.)
  * Ability to write simple, to moderately complex, scripts and programs for automation, tools, frameworks, dashboards, alarms. (common uses: Python, Go)
  * Experience with common scripting languages such as Python, Groovy, Powershell
  * Ability to document process/procedures.
  * Ability to perform code-review for quality and adherence to company style guides.
  * On-call rotation with other team members, subject matter expertise in a private cloud

## Key Qualifications

  * 5+ years of experience working in a large scale production environment.
  * Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.
  * 2-3 business-related trips per year for group meetings
  * Must work effectively and professionally with cross-functional groups across divisions, worldwide, as part of a team.
  * Must be able to work with a distributed team across multiple time zones.
  * Must exhibit meticulous attention to detail, and have the ability to make good, timely decisions.
  * Demonstrate self-learning capabilities, taking initiative in a fast pace/quickly changing environment.
  * Security-mindset, general understanding of cybersecurity principles.

## Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike

  * Market leader in compensation and equity awards
  * Competitive vacation policy
  * Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
  * Paid parental leave, including adoption
  * Flexible work environment
  * Wellness programs
  * Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.

Notice of E-Verify Participation

title: Java Developer
text:
Are you a Software Engineer with strong Java background? Are you interested in working on AI-powered software used by some of the largest brands in the world? If so, we want to hear from you!

Based in Palo Alto, CA, we are an industry leading Analytics company recognized internationally for our innovative platform! Our cutting edge software suite empowers businesses of all sizes to make the most out of a $400 Billion dollar market! We are using the latest ML and data science technologies to help our clients see anywhere from 30-40% performance improvement over traditional methods! As we continue to grow, we have an urgent need for Senior Java Engineers to join our team!

title: Junior Accountant, Accounts Payable
text:
Synthego is looking to add to its Finance & Accounting team by adding a Junior AP Accountant. Core responsibilities include accounts payable processing as well as assisting with month-end close activities. This role is great for someone with limited experience who wants to continue learning and growing in their accounting career.

What You'll Do

  * Complete payments and controls expenses by receiving, processing, verifying, and reconciling invoices.
  * Responsible for setting up vendor payments including electronic ACH transfers and manual checks.
  * Verify vendor accounts by reconciling monthly statements and related transactions and responds to inquiries regarding vendor issues and statements reconciliation
  * Report and accrue for sales taxes by calculating requirements on paid invoices
  * Maintain vendors accounts, including overseeing the implementation of new vendors in the accounting system, updating of W-9s and preparation of 1099-Misc reports.
  * Coordinate and pay international vendors in foreign currencies.
  * Responsible for reviewing and reconciling corporate credit card transactions each month to ensure the expenses are in accordance with the company's policy.
  * Assist in the monthly financial statement close.

About You

  * Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance
  * 1 - 2 years of relevant experience preferred
  * Hands-on experience working with accounts payables and general ledgers preferred
  * Strong written and verbal communication skills
  * Excellent problem-solving skills
  * Proficient with ERP systems, including Microsoft Office preferred
  * Able to multi-task and prioritize work effectively

Company Benefits & Perks

  * Competitive salary
  * Generous equity at an early stage company
  * Robust medical, dental and vision benefits
  * 401k Plan
  * Fully stocked kitchen and snacks
  * Free catered lunches and dinners
  * Onsite Gym
  * Daily Shuttle bus to & from San Francisco (more locations to come)

About Us

Synthego is a genome engineering company that enables the acceleration of life science research and development in the pursuit of improved human health.

The company leverages machine learning, automation, and gene editing to build platforms for science at scale. With its foundations in engineering disciplines, the company's platforms vertically integrate proprietary hardware, software, bioinformatics, chemistries, and molecular biology to advance basic research, target validation, and clinical trials.

By providing both commercial and academic researchers and therapeutic developers with unprecedented access to cutting-edge genome engineering, Synthego is at the forefront of innovation, accelerating the development of truly engineered biology.

title: MTS2 - Software Engineer
text:
Apply

R0040116

Looking to make a quick and significant impact on one of the world's largest e-commerce platform? Are you interested in continuous innovation to break the technical challenges at the scale of eBay's billions of traffic and petabytes of data? We have a place for you!

We are looking for passionate, self-motivated, and top-notch software engineers to join our team to innovate and build scalable solutions to make eBay's staging environment production alike in terms of data and availability. This staging environment is the centralized test environment to perform all automation and manual testing used by every developer and quality engineer across the marketplace. It serves every critical eBay domain, including Buyer Experience, Selling Experience, Payments, and Structured Data.

This is a company-wide initiative that gives the unique and rare opportunity to learn the complex and scalable architecture of every domain on eBay. You will work in an agile environment with talented engineers in the team and visibility to the top leadership.

## Minimum Qualifications

  * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.

title: Software Engineer, Energy Optimization
text:
**The Role**

The Energy Optimization team develops and maintains the high-level control systems for Megapacks, Powerwalls, Virtual Power Plants, and microgrids. Our systems continuously forecast the availability and price of energy, determine optimal control strategies, and dispatch energy in real-time. We have repeatedly demonstrated success in residential, commercial, and utility-scale settings.

We are looking for talented software engineers to help build the platforms necessary for the next phase of our growth. You will help define new control strategies, extend our services to new applications and markets, and scale our infrastructure to support hundreds of gigawatt-hours around the globe. You will contribute to real-time control systems - both embedded and cloud - and to the offline platforms used for algorithm development and training.

## Responsibilities

  * Define and develop simple, generalized control systems to satisfy a range of applications and markets
  * Define and develop offline training platforms
  * Work across the stack as necessary, from device to cloud
  * Contribute to a culture of operational excellence
  * Learn fast and do whatever it takes

## Requirements

  * A passion for sustainable energy
  * Proven ability to define and develop products
  * Proven ability to develop and operate resilient systems, embedded and/or cloud
  * Excellence in a couple of languages (we mostly use Scala and Python) and proficiency in others
  * A strong predilection for good software and the processes that make it
  * Complete comfort in a Linux environment
  * Proven ability to work across the stack in a fast-paced environment
  * Excellent communication

## Bonus Experience

  * Containerization and orchestration, AWS, continuous integration and deployment, configuration control, monitoring and alerting
  * Machine learning (especially time-series forecasting) and advanced numerical methods (e.g. linear optimization, distributed control)
  * Modeling physical systems and/or markets
  * IoT platforms

title: Paranoids Principal Production Engineer
text:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you're looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon's media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and HuffPost help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we're transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.

When you impact millions of people every day, you become a large target for adversaries in all layers of the stack.

We are the information security team at Verizon Media. People call us " **The Paranoids** ".

Specifically, we are the Paranoids Engineering Team, we research and build innovative security capabilities to proactively protect, shield and defend Verizon Media infrastructure to keep our users and data safe from targeted attacks, account hijacking and other cyber threats.

You will be responsible for maintaining and scaling end-to-end features to help make one of the world's largest internet services the most secure and user friendly, working with seasoned architects, data scientists, creative product managers and a group of very bright engineers. Using a combination of open source software and internal tools, you will engineer automated solutions for container-based application serving, ingress routing, cluster management, continuous delivery pipelines, developer productivity tools, among others. You have the ability to multitask in order to facilitate the resolution of multiple incidents at any given time; and the vision to automate in order to better scale and streamline the processes. By writing, designing and implementing software to drive velocity, operability, reliability and performance, you will ensure continuous quality on production systems as you embed deeply in the many layers and stages of software development

We Are looking for an engineer who

  * Has a passion for solving difficult technical problems, from the network to the user experience
  * Likes to relentlessly automate everything and anything at scale
  * Wants to make back-end systems faster, more reliable and more secure
  * Has excellent written and verbal communication skills
  * Has the ability to quickly learn and apply new technologies within a dynamic and extremely fast-paced environment
  * Thinks outside the box to build systems that collect, instrument, analyse data and provide insights about the system

## Responsibilities

  * Manage paranoids' services at vast scale and their associated infrastructure and tools for stability and performance
  * Support the operability roadmap to improve the availability, performance, scalability and efficiency of the services by implementing monitoring, automation, redundancy, capacity and business continuity planning
  * Design, create, maintain, and document tools and automation for handling system state and operational excellence across a complex global infrastructure.
  * Participate in on-call rotation, drive incident resolution, live troubleshooting and impact mitigation
  * Capacity Management for all tiers across multiple applications
  * Participate in weekly scrum team planning meetings and daily stand-ups
  * Participate in design and architecture review discussions
  * Implement, and maintain monitoring to provide complete transparency to application and system state, history, and trends.
  * Create runbooks, and provide training for engineers responsible for providing 24x7 site up services for the application portfolio.

## Requirements

  * 4 + year experience in DevOps or Software Development roles
  * Fluency in one or more of Python, Go, Java, NodeJS
  * Familiarity with web servers and web services API
  * Experience with container and cloud technologies like Docker and AWS
  * Experience with Unix operating systems, including the ability to tune the OS, web applications, containers and related technologies
  * Knowledge of IP networking, DNS, load balancing and CDNs
  * Troubleshooting skills in heterogeneous computing and networking environments
  * Experience with monitoring, alerting and deployment
  * BS, MS in Computer Science or related field

## Preferred Qualifications

  * Deep understanding of Linux system internals, shell scripting, troubleshooting tools for application stack and networking
  * Experience with building CI/CD pipelines
  * Experience with web technologies like REST APIs, gRPC, JSON, etc
  * Deep understanding of network security, TLS, authentication and authorization
  * Good understanding of web related security issues.
  * Working knowledge of RDBMS, SQL and NoSQL

title: Strategic Communications Writer
text:
C3.ai is a leading enterprise AI software provider for accelerating digital transformation. The comprehensive and proven C3 AI Suite uses a model-driven abstraction layer to enable organizations to develop, deploy, and operate enterprise scale AI applications 40x to 100x faster than alternative approaches. www.c3.ai

We are looking for a seasoned and motivated Strategic Communications Writer to create compelling narratives and materials about our company, products, technology, and industry trends in support of the company's growth, brand awareness, and thought leadership objectives. As a member of C3.ai's growing marketing team, the Strategic Communications Writer will drive writing and editing projects, including executive communications, demand generation, digital content, corporate communications, brand building, social media, blogs, product information, sales enablement, and events.

This role is integral in creating the communications content that underpin C3.ai's marketing. This position requires a high level of creativity and initiative, as well as the ability to conduct research, interview senior executives, and use data-driven insights to write compelling content of various lengths and formats. Top-notch written and verbal communications, outstanding organizational skills, and high attention to detail are a must.

Candidates should be able to understand complex details across business and technology, business processes, and economic value, and communicate that complexity with simplicity and clarity across media. A successful candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment and demonstrate an ability to execute precisely and quickly. He or she must possess an understanding of enterprise software and have writing samples that showcase a range of styles covering business-related topics.

## Your Responsibilities

  * Regularly produce various long- and short-form content, including in-depth case studies, white papers, blogs, op-eds, speeches/scripts/talking points, press releases, web content, emails, and social media posts
  * Collaborate with Creative Services in developing strategic presentations for CEO/executive keynotes and other high-profile events, shaping the presentation's narrative, structure, and information content
  * Research markets and industries to identify best practices and compelling content
  * Perform primary research for blog posts, articles, presentations, white papers, guides, and other content
  * Review and edit content produced by other members of the marketing team
  * Manage content revision and editing process with internal stakeholders
  * Collaborate and brainstorm with other teams to create innovative content ideas

## Requirements

  * BA/BS in English, journalism, marketing, or related field (combination with computer science degree, study or certification is a plus)
  * 10-12 years minimum experience
  * Stellar writing skills and experience creating long- and short-form content for all B2B marketing channels
  * Understanding of B2B software audiences and purchase cycles
  * Strong research skills and desire to learn about a wide range of topics
  * Proven ability to work effectively with senior executives and lead projects from conception to final execution with excellence
  * Outstanding teamwork, communication, and organizational skills
  * Self-motivated, creative, high energy, and resourceful
  * Results-oriented, committed to quality of product, and exceptional attention to detail
  * Strong project management skills and ability to work under deadline
  * Familiarity with AI/machine learning, IoT, big data, and cloud technology

C3.ai provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits including:

  * Competitive salary, generous stock options, 401K, medical, dental, and vision benefits. At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered breakfast and lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people.

C3.ai is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

title: Software Development Engineer- Compiler
text:
At AWS AI, we want to make it easy for our customers to deploy machine learning models on any endpoint in the cloud or at the edge. Just as SageMaker provides a complete set of services to simplify the task of building and training a model, Neo provides an inference engine that is designed to run any machine learning model on any hardware.

Neo optimizes machine learning models to perform at up to twice the speed of the original framework with no loss in accuracy. Upload a pre-trained model built with MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or XGBoost to your S3 bucket, choose your target hardware platform from Intel, NVIDIA, or ARM, and with a single API call, SageMaker Neo optimizes the model, converts it into an executable module, and returns it to your S3 bucket. The free open source Neo runtime uses less than 100th of the space of the framework to run the model on the target hardware.

The SageMaker Neo team is growing rapidly to keep up with growth in customers and their requests. We are hiring well-rounded applied scientists and software developers with backgrounds in machine learning, compilers, systems, and AI accelerators. If have worked on HPC and performance tuning, you will enjoy working on the breadth of ML applications that we optimize.

As a deep learning platform developer, you will create systematic approaches to improve the performance of deep learning inference. You will help develop the compilation service and runtime for machine learning. The work offers an extremely broad set of opportunities to work as a full stack SDE with exposure to multiple AI applications, ML frameworks, models, compilers, systems SW, and various AI hardware including ARM, Intel, AWS Inferentia, and NVidia.

Join the Amazon SageMaker Neo team to help AWS customers deploy machine learning models in the cloud and on edge devices at scale in production. Work on an open source industry-standard compiler and runtime for machine learning that is already deployed on over 20 million devices.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Female
/ Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

## Basic Qualifications

  * Master's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  * 2+ years of software development experience in high performance computing, machine learning, big data analytics, or related areas
  * 2+ years of software development experience in system security -- encryption, access control, auditing, trusted execution, selinux, container security, or related technologies

## Preferred Qualifications

  * Proven ability to develop and deliver an optimizing compiler for high level / domain specific programming language
  * 4+ years technical leadership role in machine learning, HPC, system security, or related areas
  * PhD in Computer Science

title: Creative Services Coordinator - Entry Level (Remote)
text:
At CrowdStrike we're on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We've earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people - clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you're ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let's talk.

## About The Role

CrowdStrike is seeking a Creative Services Coordinator to join our Creative Services team. This role will report to the Director, Integrated Production and requires a "jack-of-all-trades" whose ultimate goal is to produce the highest quality work; on time and in budget. Duties for this role include:

  * Support of day-to-day production operations: project tracking, scheduling, asset inventory, resource allocation, vendor relations and general comms
  * Work closely with Designers, Managers and Creative Director to maintain and update templates/style guides on a regular basis, and suggest when new templates, systems or protocols need to be created
  * Collaborate with our cross-functional team on a variety of projects including, but not limited to: digital/display, social, print, OOH, video, events, experiential/interactive, web services and e-commerce
  * Maintain project tracking system (Asana) by developing file naming protocols, contact sheets, file size management and organization on our internal server (Dropbox, Box)
  * Assist in the rollout of international campaigns, translations and creative assets

A successful candidate must have excellent communications skills, a willingness to learn, and a background in project management/production. As deadlines often fluctuate, the right candidate should be one who can easily manage a fluid communications process and have the ability to think critically, creatively and collaboratively. Agency experience is a plus.

_This role is targeting candidates remotely in Los Angeles, CA._

## What You'll Need

  * Bachelor's Degree
  * Portfolio Submission
  * 1 - 3 years of production/project management experience with an agency, design firm or in-house marketing team
  * Proficient knowledge of Asana, Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, Figma, InVision, Dropbox, Box, Microsoft Suite & Google Drive
  * Ability to work in high pressure, fast-paced production environment
  * Good time management skills; good multi-tasker and attention to detail is key

## Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike

  * Market leader in compensation and equity awards
  * Competitive vacation policy
  * Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
  * Paid parental leave, including adoption
  * Flexible work environment
  * Wellness programs
  * Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Test Engineer
text:
Job ID:JR0141428

Job Category:Engineering

Primary Location:Santa Clara, CA US

Other Locations:

Job Type:Experienced Hire

## Test Engineer Job Description

Come and join us! Intel is seeking highly qualified candidates to join our Data Platform Group (DPG) as a Test Engineer! Barefoot Networks (BXD) is part of the Ethernet Networking Division in Intel's DPG, and we're looking for motivated, passionate and talented engineers to join our Operations team. BXD is a strong, vibrant cross-site team which helps drive Intel's Ethernet technology and products to position Intel x86 as the server platform of choice and Intel Ethernet products as Ethernet of choice for the Cloud, Communications and Data Center deployments.

In this role as an ATE (Automated Testing Equipment) Test Engineer, you should have a track record in delivering products in the semiconductor model with knowledge covering the full manufacturing flow including fab, test, DFT, package assembly and qualification. You will be responsible for developing test programs and hardware for wafer probe and package test for characterization and production testing of high performance networking and machine learning ICs. You'll utilize the ATE equipment tools and capabilities to optimize final test programs without compromising the quality of outgoing products. You will also be responsible for developing and working with external suppliers/vendors on execution of test and characterization plans and supporting the full life cycle of the product from design to volume manufacturing.

## Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To

  * Work with Design, DFT and Product Engineering teams to translate concepts to product testing requirements, develop documentation, loadboard and socket design specifications, and ATE final test programs
  * Design high performance IC test vectors for Power/Voltage/Temperature (PVT) corners, signal and power integrity characterization and participate in silicon debug, electrical failure analysis (EFA) and physical failure analysis (PFA)
  * Develop high speed analog and digital interface test methodologies and implement ATE test, characterization programs and work with IC and systems design teams on correlation
  * Work on wafer and package level test hardware and software development and bring up offshore test house by completing necessary correlation analysis
  * Establish manufacturing requirements and specification for delivery of the product and drive to close potential test gaps and correlations issues across the product supply chain
  * Manage interactions with local and offshore test vendors to ensure deployment of test programs with high quality.

The ideal candidate will have the following skills in addition to the qualifications listed below:

  * Must be a team player, with demonstrated expertise to technically influence others.

- Strong problem-solving skills.-

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

In this position you will gain invaluable experience which will allow growth and expanded opportunities within this business group as well as future possible opportunities with other business groups within Intel. The Data Platform Group (DPG) drives new products technologies from high-end co- processors for supercomputers to low-energy systems for enterprise and the cloud, as well as solutions for big data and intelligent devices. The group is a worldwide organization that develops the products and technologies that power 9 of every 10 servers sold worldwide

## Qualifications

**Minimum Required Qualifications:**

  * Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent with 9+ years of relevant experience
  * 6+ years of experience in wafer probe card design, ATE hardware design and managing suppliers on execution of test hardware development and bring-up
  * 6+ years of experience in test engineering, DFT, test hardware and test program development
  * 6+ years of experience in developing test programs on Advantest 93k for digital or mixed signal chips

## Additional Preferred Qualifications

  * Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
  * 5+ years of experience in IC product development and manufacturing, including characterization, qualification, bring-up, yield improvement and debug
  * 5+ years of experience with scripting (C, C++, Python or Perl)
  * 5+ years experience with probability and statistical fundamentals for data analysis using tools such as JMP
  * 5+ years' experience developing presentations for vendor and partner

**Inside this Business Group**

The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel's transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

**Posting Statement**

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance....

title: Cell Technician - Core Automation
text:
**The Role**

Tesla is seeking a technician to support vision systems on the Core Automation Engineering (CAE) Cell Manufacturing team and be part of a world-class team that are responsible for designing and building the automated and robotic equipment at the Tesla factories. The vision systems (smart cameras, depth sensors, etc.) are deployed in both equipment and manufacturing environments for a variety of tasks, but this role focuses on cell manufacturing quality inspections. The ideal candidate has demonstrated an interest in computer and industrial systems, especially cameras. They should also want to be on the front line of the most advanced manufacturing facilities in the world.

Daily roles and responsibilities include hands-on, lineside deployment and maintenance of the vision systems and sensor systems. While system design, code, and hardware will generally come from software and mechanical engineers, getting the systems to work, i.e., testing them and working with engineers to fix them, is the role of the technician. This includes, for example, image collection and validation of machine learning and pattern recognition models.

While Tesla has a 24-hour support team for the manufacturing line, the technician is the secondary responder and will be responsible for swiftly bring the systems back online if they fail. In other words, 24-hour on-call is not part of the role, but serious and rare failure events may lead to after- hours work.

Tesla provides training on all software required to perform the role - no prior experience with machine learning or software engineering needed, although a willingness to learn is crucial.

The key objective of the Automation team is developing new and innovative solutions in the factory and help Tesla achieve its ambitious manufacturing goals. All of these automated manufacturing processes will be planned, assembled and tested at our Tesla facilities located in Fremont, California.

## Responsibilities

  * Understand basic cell quality issues and help determine if inspecting them automatically with the vision systems is possible (after hands-on training)
  * Collaborate with relevant teams to determine optimal locations to install hardware
  * Install line-side equipment, including cameras and computer hardware
  * Wiring, networking and operating computer programs within an industrial/manufacturing environment
  * Bolting brackets, and basic hand tool usage
  * Use software to load images into a program, sort and label them and then monitor how the program labels the same images
  * Support engineers as they iterate on these systems by providing direct feedback on how the systems are functioning on the line
  * Monitor alerts and determine with available data if something is failing, and how to quickly fix it
  * Collaborate with quality engineers to communicate time periods of failure of the system

## Minimum Requirements

  * (Preferred) 1 year of experience working in an industrial or technical organization
  * Solid computer skills including specific experience with file systems and basic understanding of computer networks
  * Basic understanding of electrical safety
  * Solid written communication skills and willingness to document
  * Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced environment
  * High school diploma or equivalent

title: Software Development Engineer
text:
Have you ever wanted to work on state of the art embedded devices that perform computer vision, natural language processing and applied machine learning that will make a lasting impact on society?

We are looking for brilliant Software Development Engineers who have the passion to tackle tough problems by bringing cutting edge technologies to consumer IoT products at Amazon!

As a Software Development Engineer on the Amazon AI Device Team, you will design and develop reliable, scalable, and high-performance embedded devices that help move computer vision and machine learning into new markets. You will be an integral member of the device team, responsible to design, develop and implement embedded software for AI devices ecosystem.

You'll work with senior engineers within Amazon AI and develop high quality device software that is robust and reliable.

We are looking for talented and passionate Embedded Software Engineers to be part of an exciting team.

Software Engineers at Amazon do so much more than just software development. We'll be looking at you to help:

  * Decide what features to build.
  * Drive software engineering best practice.
  * Design distributed and scalable systems.
  * Test and document the software you develop.

## Basic Qualifications

  * 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  * Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  * 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.

## Preferred Qualifications

  * Master's Degree or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering or related field, or equivalent experience.
  * 3+ years of Experience with software development for embedded systems and/or Linux based devices.
  * Experience with Multi Process , Multi-threaded Linux system software and strong Linux fundamentals.
  * Mainly C/C++ Coding skills with knowledge of object-oriented design.
  * Experience designing secure IoT software for embedded Micro-controllers (ARM).
  * Experience in integrating IoT systems with cloud computing/ AWS services.
  * Experience with GPU's and Computer vision stack is a plus.
  * Experience building Embedded device platform software is a plus.
  * Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: UI Systems Engineer (Remote)
text:
At CrowdStrike we're on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We've earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people - clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you're ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let's talk.

## About The Team

We're building a welcoming & flexible team that prizes collaboration over competition, one which provides opportunities to learn new skills, mentor junior developers and contribute to the direction of both the team & the products we're responsible for. This is a high trust environment where we allow team members to manage their own time, take holidays as they need it and reward them with competitive salaries and equity.

Our stack is Ember, but if you've used frameworks like React or Angular you're the kind of person we're looking for and we'll help get you up to speed. As we support only evergreen browsers we can push the boundaries of what's possible on the web as a platform, on top of a system that strips any hyperbole from the term "big data". In close collaboration with analysts & clients you'll get to see the apps & visualisations you're building used every day to hunt for hackers and protect systems.

Our ideal candidates are sensitive to the needs of the users of their software
& love learning more about their tools every day. Get excited about new features in Chrome Devtools? Tested your work in screen readers? Ever lost half an hour getting an animation's bezier curve to be just the _right_ kind of bouncy? Looking for a challenge that's out of the ordinary? Get in touch.

## About The Role

The UI Systems Engineer builds, maintains, and improves the tools that build and deploy UI applications as well as verify quality and optimize developer experience. Examples include linting, type checking, code formatting, continuous integration configuration, process automation, multithreading, project layout, and building and maintaining our end-to-end test framework.

title: AV Software Engineer
text:
We are seeking exceptional candidates to join our growing Autonomous Vehicle
(AV) business team! AVs are an important part of Ford's future and we're looking for the best and brightest. The role will require critical thinking, problem solving capabilities, and a "get it done" attitude to help make strategic decisions that will enable Ford to be a leader in autonomy, connectivity, mobility, analytics and customer experience.

## Responsibilities Include

As a member of our Autonomous Vehicle team, you will contribute to projects related to:

  * Development of advanced software and algorithms that contribute to the robust operation of autonomous vehicles
  * Develop highly available and performant software
  * Development of scenarios and use cases to ensure comprehensive and credible validation of the developed algorithms and autonomous vehicle systems
  * Collaborate with diverse team members in a wide range of disciplines including Robotics, Control Engineering, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Vehicle Dynamics, Perception, Localization, Routing, and Mapping
  * In-vehicle and simulated validation and testing

**Minimum Qualification:**

  * Bachelor's degree in computer science or computer engineering, or a bachelor's degree in other related science and engineering fields with experience in software, data structures algorithms, and compiled languages.
  * 3+ years of software development experience using modern C++ or another compiled language.
  * 3+ years of C++ software design and debugging skills in a POSIX environment

**Preferred Qualification:**

  * Masters or PhD in computer science with experience in automotive and/or robotics or computer vision/perception
  * Fluent with development in a Linux environment
  * Experience in analyzing complex systems and architecting systems and algorithms to meet performance targets
  * Strong math fundamentals
  * Familiarity with industrial and scientific simulators and their software architecture
  * Familiarity with autonomous driving including any of: routing, mapping, localization, sensing, and perception.
  * Experience in the design and architecture of safety-critical systems
  * Familiarity with GPU technology (or another hardware accelerator), image processing, and computer vision
  * Familiar with working in a team-based project, across multiple disciplines, e.g., hardware design and implementation, data acquisition and analysis, mathematical modeling, algorithm development, application implementation, etc.
  * Proficiency in multiple operating systems such as Windows, Linux, MacOS, etc.
  * Demonstrated experience engineering, architecting, and implementing software in a variety of domains, e.g., automotive, aerospace, robotics, etc.
  * Experience with UDP, TCP, CAN and network routing
  * Communication skills and the ability to write technical documentation
  * Knowledge and experience in agile software development and testing methodologies
  * Ability to setup and manage development tools (e.g. build systems, containers, source control, CI/CD, etc...)
  * Experience with software development for real-time systems ( could be combined with safety-critical systems )
  * Experience in designing and implementing efficient and low-latency software for complex algorithms
  * Experience/Familiarity with ASIL ratings for software

Join our team as we create tomorrow! We believe in putting people first, working together, and facing challenges head-on, because we're Built Ford Tough. We're one team striving to make people's lives better while creating value, delivering excellence and ultimately going for thewin.

Visa sponsorship may be available for this position.

Ford Motor Company is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

title: Salesforce Developer (Remote)
text:
At CrowdStrike we're on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We've earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people - clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you're ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let's talk.

## About The Role

CrowdStrike is looking for a Salesforce System Administrator to join our fast growing Customer Applications team. In this role, you will be responsible for the administration of Salesforce and related applications. Based on a deep understanding of Salesforce technology, you will work closely with our team of Business Systems Analysts and business users to develop best practice solutions and processes.

## What You'll Do

  * Translate business requirements into well-architected solutions that best leverage the Salesforce platform
  * Develop, test, and document working custom development, integrations, and data migrations for Salesforce features, applications and projects.
  * Manage daily support and maintenance of our Salesforce instance and conduct long-term improvement operations to ensure compatibility with evolving mission requirements
  * Communicate with team members and stakeholders to ensure effective collaboration throughout all phases of development, testing and deployment
  * Maintain a flexible and proactive work environment
  * Participate in code reviews for ongoing projects to ensure that code quality is at the highest level possible and appropriate design patterns are being used
  * Execute test plans to ensure a quality solution is delivered
  * Provide detailed estimates and work breakdown structure for assigned tasks
  * Provide system administration support of our Salesforce environment

## What You'll Need

  * Bachelor's degree in computer science
  * At least five years of software development and three years of Salesforce application development
  * Self-motivated and creative
  * Understanding of how to build reusable, lightweight code in Apex, including writing comprehensive tests to ensure code coverage.
  * Working knowledge of Lightning Web Components and/or at least 2 years experience writing Javascript code.
  * At least 2 years developing code on the Lightning Framework.
  * Experience with BitBucket or GitHub.
  * Strong problem solving abilities
  * Security minded and strong working knowledge of vulnerabilities around SOQL, Apex, and other areas of the platform that can be leveraged by bad actors.

**Bonus Points**

  * Salesforce Developer Certifications
  * Experinece developing UI
  * Experience developing REST/SOAP API

## Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike

  * Market leader in compensation and equity awards
  * Competitive vacation policy
  * Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
  * Paid parental leave, including adoption
  * Flexible work environment
  * Wellness programs
  * Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Financial Analyst (Full Time) - United States
text:
## What You'll Do

Cisco's LIFT (Leaders in Finance & Technology) Program develops future finance leaders and CFOs. This leadership development program for recent college graduates provides a breadth of accounting and finance experiences during your first 2 years of employment through 4 meaningful and rare roles. This program is available in both San Jose, CA and RTP, NC. The experiences combine with an extensive training curriculum that aligns with each 6-month assignment. In your roles, you will have opportunities to:

  * Craft new and dynamic business models and come up with profitable strategies
  * Turn data into the information that will take on business problems
  * Assist in finding the balance between giving our shareholders the greatest value and meeting the technological and business needs of our customers
  * Learn and develop the business insight and technical skills necessary to excel as a future finance leader
  * Collaborate and interact with finance Leaders, cross-functional teams, and other LIFT professionals

## Who You'll Work With

LIFT is a connected community of early career professionals who like to win together.

We are a part of our exceptional global finance organization with business partners across all of Cisco. You will collaborate and network with global teams and our world-class senior leadership.

## Who You Are

  * Must graduate within one year of start date. Start date is August 2021.
  * Real passion for finance, leadership and technology
  * Understand business and industry trends
  * Exceptional communicator and contributor to teams
  * Advocate for Cisco, Cisco Finance & LIFT
  * Flourish in a dynamic, changing environment

**Why Cisco**

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here's how we do it.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we're "old" (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we're also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do - you can't put us in a box!

But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!
